citation.article-title: Rhodanobacter ginsenosidimutans sp. nov., isolated from soil of a ginseng field in South Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodanobacter ginsenosidimutans sp. nov.
Rhodanobacter ginsenosidimutans (gin.se.no.si.di.mu′tans. N.L. n. ginsenosidum ginsenoside; L. part. adj. mutans transforming, converting; N.L. part. adj. ginsenosidimutans ginsenoside-converting).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-motile and rod-shaped, 0.4–0.6 μm wide and 1.1–1.3 μm long after 3 days on R2A agar (Difco).
Colonies grown on R2A agar for 3 days are smooth, circular, convex, transparent and yellowish.
On R2A agar, grows at 15–37 °C, but not at 4 or 42 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 4–10 and in up to 5 % NaCl; optimal growth is at pH 7.0 and without NaCl.
Substrate utilization, enzyme production and other physiological characteristics are indicated in Table 1.
In addition to the carbon sources listed in Table 1, utilizes histidine and l-alanine as sole carbon sources.

Does not utilize adipate, caprate, citrate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, dl-lactate, malate, propionate, l-proline, l-serine or suberate as sole carbon sources.

According to the API ZYM gallery, produces acid phosphatase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, leucine arylamidase, α-mannosidase and valine arylamidase, but not α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase or trypsin.
Q-8 is the predominant ubiquinone and iso-C15 : 0, 10-methyl C16 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 are the predominant cellular fatty acids.
The type strain is Gsoil 3054T (=KACC 12822T =DSM 21013T =KCTC 22231T =LMG 24457T), isolated from soil of a ginseng field of Pocheon province, South Korea.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.6 mol%.
